result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah C Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain fultlime employment and/or school and it not then must complete 10 hours community service per week.

Counseling

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 3:30pm. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Deft appears prose. Crt advises defendant rights to counsel.  *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed*.  PLEA: GUILTY - ct 1 (dc). COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  def is competent to represent self: a factual basis & def guilty. Statements by State.  COURT ORDERS: SWH -1 yr probation, concurent to current probation in Wood County Cases. CONDITIONS: Counseling; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school and if not must complete 10 hrs Community Service per week; Court Costs; DNA Surcharge. Adjourned:  3:41pm.

Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on July 9, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Jury Trial on August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No violent contact with G.M. and W.P.
